sentences: Toshi Reagon (born January 27, 1964) is an American musician of folk, blues, gospel, rock and funk, as well as a composer, curator, and producer.
Born January 27, 1964 in Atlanta, Georgia, Reagon grew up in Washington, D.C.
Her mother, Bernice Johnson Reagon, founded the all-woman a capella group Sweet Honey in the Rock in 1973, which had a profound influence on her.

Reagon lists 1970's rock & roll bands such as Led Zeppelin, Black Sabbath, and Kiss, as well as classic Blues musicians such as Big Mama Thornton, Howlin' Wolf, and Big Bill Broonzy as additional musical influences.
Reagon's first album, Justice, was released in 1990 through Flying Fish Records.
Since then, she has released many solo albums, including her most recent SpiritLand in December 2018.
Her band, BIGLovely, has been performing since September 1996.
Reagon's Parable of the Sower rock-opera, based on the novel by Octavia Butler, had its world premiere at NYU Abu Dhabi Arts Center in fall 2017.
section: == Career == | === Parable of the Sower Opera ===

sentences: On April 26, 2019, it was performed at the O'Shaughnessy Auditorium in Saint Paul, Minnesota.
section: == Career == | === Parable of the Sower Opera ===

sentences: Reagon's "congregational opera" was first performed in 2015 at both the Public Theater’s Under the Radar Festival and at The Arts Center at NYU Abu Dhabi (NYUAD) in 2017.
